alert.note: Alert for Ohio; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 9:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Ohio and Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Carroll and Owen. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 952 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Carrollton, Vevay, Pleasant, Fairview, Ghent, Worthville, Prestonville, Braytown, Mount Sterling, Easterday, General Butler State Park, Moorefield, Interstate 71 at State Route 227, Langstaff, Jacksonville, English, Center Square, Locust, Eagle Station and Avonburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
